Key Match Events: The Lakers made just one field goal — a James three — in the final 3:30.
Durant and Devin Booker helped the Suns quickly push back into the game.
The Lakers started the fourth quarter up seven and let the Suns get right back into the game.
Pre-Game Insights: JJ Redick made a prediction that it would drive him crazy if the Lakers lose.
Redick said he would take responsibility for the Lakers' loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Redick took responsibility for the Lakers' 14-point second quarter and for the hesitation in double-teaming Kevin Durant.
James said the loss was inevitable in the league but how the team plays each week and each game will define what type of team they want to be.
Reaves said Redick's passion is on another level and that he's a great leader.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers led 26-8 less than seven minutes into the game.
Davis finished with 29 points, 15 rebounds, and three blocks to lead the Lakers.
Redick decided to intentionally foul LeBron James with 6.4 seconds left to try to create an offensive rebound.
Others: The game was affected by the wildfires in L.A. County, which caused the postponement of the Lakers' home game against the Hornets.
